@helper

Use @helper decorator to call a function during template rendering.

Usage

@helper
def function():
    return x

Decorated function returns

Variable which will be available during rendering using function name as a keyword. Supported are python built-in variables like str, list, dict, int, etc.

Example

from stado import helper, run

@helper
def hello():
    return 'Hello badger!'

run()

Template:

{{ hello }}

Rendered template:

Hello badger!

Details

Helper function can return list, dict or other python built-in objects:

@helper
def numbers():
    return [1, 2, 3, 4]

Template:

{{# numbers }}{{ . }}{{/ numbers }}

Rendered template:

1234

Function decorated by @helper can use pages and assets controllers. This controllers returns list of item objects like pages or assets. For example:

Example project structure:

project/
  site.py
  index.html
  welcome.html
  contact.html

File site.py:

from stado import helper, run

@helper
def menu():
    return [i.url for i in pages('*.html')]

run()

File index.html:

{{# menu }}
<a href='{{ url }}'>Page</a>
{{/ menu }}

Rendered file output/index.html:

<a href='index.html'>Page</a>
<a href='welcome.html'>Page</a>
<a href='contact.html'>Page</a>
